revised_title: Diffuse Reflexions of X-rays and Their Implications in Crystallography
tldr: The author, Sir William Bragg, investigates the diffuse spots in X-ray crystal photographs and explains their relationship to the geometry of the true diffraction patterns of the crystal. He demonstrates how the positions and forms of the diffuse spots correspond closely to the calculated patterns, and discusses the implications of these findings for understanding crystal structures and the behavior of X-rays in crystals.
